intro: Randia eucodon, commonly known as the redroot sandmat, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many other ornamental and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered white flowers and its ability to thrive in sandy, well-drained soils. Its leaves are typically alternate and ovate, with a slightly hairy texture. Randia eucodon is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
